solution_line_template: First multiply Marla's one-way driving time by {num_trips} to find her total driving time: {one_way_drive} minutes * {num_trips} = <<{one_way_drive}*{num_trips}={total_drive}>>{total_drive} minutes

Then add Marla's driving time to the time spent attending the conference to find the total time: {conference_time} minutes + {total_drive} minutes = <<{conference_time}+{total_drive}={total_time}>>{total_time} minutes
